Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is covered with dark-brown resinous and cream-coloured granular deposits, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394467) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394467)
